page.title: 05Buxhall - Farming: Issues
page.content: Whilst farming is important to the area its success is currently causing some concern.{Disposal of surplus {cereal straw}by burning is considered unsocial by causing pollution, damage to countryside and wildlife. Local demand for straw is limited. With little needed for livestock, some is sold for processing into animal feed or building board but most has to be otherwise disposed of. With the threat of a total ban on burning farmers are increasingly chopping and ploughing in the straw. Modern farming methods have necessitated the{removal of several {old hedges,}although the large scale removal of woodland is no longer considered economically viable. The {EEC Agricultural Policy,}creating surplus cereal production places an uncertain future on farming and thus the future prosperity of the area.
